sourcePath.description: The directory that holds components(subdirectories) to be synced, can include a regex

componentPathExtraDepth.description: The number of extra nesting levels to add to the 'components' being promoted, this allows nesting components in subdirectories while keeping them distinct. A 2 value will mean the component name includes the 3 subdirectories under the sourcePath

conditions.description: Conditions for triggering a specific promotion flows. Flows are evaluated in order, first one to match is triggered

prHasLabels.description: Array of PR labels, if the triggering PR has any of these labels the condition is considered fulfilled

autoMerge.description: If set to true, PR will be automatically merged after it is created

promotionPrs.description: List of PR that will be opened when files are changed under sourcePath

pr.description: A PR that will be opened when files are changed under sourcePath

targetPaths.description: A directory to be synced from the changed component under sourcePath

targetDescription.description: An optional string that describes the target paths, will be used in the promotion PR titles

labels.description: An optional list of labels to apply to this promotion PR. These labels will be merged with the top-level promotionPrLabels.

regex.description: Regex to configure Github event forwarding

expression.description: Directory in the repo to watch for watch

replacements.description: List of webhook endpoint to send the Github event. You can use capture groups from the regex expression

promotionPrLabels.description: List of labels to apply on PR

dryRunMode.description: If true, the bot will comment the planned promotion on the merged PR

autoApprovePromotionPrs.description: If true the bot will auto-approve all promotion PRs, with the assumption the original PR was peer reviewed and is promoted verbatim. Required additional GH token via APPROVER_GITHUB_OAUTH_TOKEN env variable

toggleCommitStatus.description: Map of strings, allow (non-repo-admin) users to change the Github commit status state(from failure to success and back). This can be used to continue promotion of a change that doesn't pass repo checks. the keys are strings commented in the PRs, values are Github commit status context to be overridden

webhookEndpointRegexs.description: List of configuration for Github event forwarding

whProxtSkipTLSVerifyUpstream.description: This disables upstream TLS server certificate validation for the webhook proxy functionality. Default is false

commentDiffonPR.description: Uses ArgoCD API to calculate expected changes to k8s state and comment the resulting 'diff' as comment in the PR

autoMergeNoDiffPRs.description: If true, Telefonistka will merge promotion PRs that are not expected to change the target clusters

useSHALabelForAppDiscovery.description: Use SHA1 of the application path as a label and rely on ArgoCD server-side filtering, label name is telefonistka.io/component-path-sha1

allowSyncfromBranchPathRegex.description: This controls which component(=ArgoCD apps) are allowed to be 'applied' from a PR branch, by setting the ArgoCD application Target Revision to PR branch

createTempAppObjectFromNewApps.description: For application created in PR Telefonistka needs to create a temporary ArgoCD Application Object to render the manifests, this key enables this behavior

promotionTargetBlockList.description: Component-level configuration only. Highest priority. List of target paths blocked from promoting. Can be regex

promotionTargetAllowList.description: Component-level configuration only. List of target paths allowed to be promoted. Can be regex

disableArgoCDDiff.description: Component-level configuration only. If true, no sensitive information stored outside kind:Secret objects is persisted to PR comments
